'''Berilac Brandybuck''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Berilac was the son of [[Merimac Brandybuck]]. He was a guest at [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo's]] [[Bilbo's Farewell Party|Farewell Party]].<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name ''Berilac'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref name="Translation">{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref>

A note in the [[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight (edition)|edition]] of the poem [[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight]] by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[E.V. Gordon]] mentions the name ''Bercilak de Hautdesert'' as the name of the [[Wikipedia:Green Knight|Green Knight]]. This mote also mentions that it is not clear if the fourth letter in the name of this character should be read as a "c" or a "t". The similar name ''Bertilak'' was used by J.R.R. Tolkien as the name of the Green Knight in his [[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Pearl, and Sir Orfeo|translation]] of the poem ''Sir Gawain and the Green Knight''.<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", "The Celtic-sounding Names", p. 201</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In an earlier version of the family tree of the Brandybuck family he had the name Bercilac.<ref>{{PM|Trees}}, manuscript BR 4</ref>
